item.title: ‘Neighbors’ Review: One Battle After Another
item.description: A quirky HBO docuseries about small-scale feuds is the latest pop-culture portrait of a country full of tiny civil wars.
item.dc:creator: James Poniewozik

item.title: ‘The Simpsons’ Hits Another Milestone
item.description: On Sunday the series, the longest running American sitcom, will air its 800th episode on Fox. In an interview, the creator Matt Groening says there’s no end in sight.
item.dc:creator: Darryn King

item.title: Dana Eden, Co-Creator of ‘Tehran,’ Dies During Filming of Fourth Season
item.description: Ms. Eden, 52, who was also an executive producer of the Emmy-winning show, was found in a hotel room in Athens. Greek police said they did not suspect foul play.
item.dc:creator: Claire Moses
item.media:description: Dana Eden at the premier of Season 2 of “Tehran” in New York in 2022.

item.title: Tom Ellis on the 1960s Movie That Blew His Mind
item.description: “It made me feel all the feels as a kid that I didn’t know I had,” said the star of “Lucifer” and the new CBS series “CIA.”
item.dc:creator: Kathryn Shattuck

item.title: James Van Der Beek, ‘Dawson’s Creek’ Actor, Dies at 48 After Cancer Battle
item.description: He first appeared in a hit TV drama as a wide-eyed 15-year-old who then grew up over six seasons. He announced he had cancer in 2024.
item.dc:creator: Anita Gates
item.media:description: James Van Der Beek in 2002. His character in “Dawson’s Creek” knew, as he put it, the “unyielding, merciless torture” of unrequited love.

item.title: In ‘Soul Power,’ a Fresh Look at the League That Helped Launch Dr. J
item.description: Executive produced by Julius Erving, a new docuseries tells the story of the A.B.A., birthplace of the 3-pointer, slam-dunk contest and a lot of style.
item.dc:creator: Stuart Miller
item.category: Soul Power: The Legend of the American Basketball Association (TV Program)

item.title: In ‘Neighbors,’ the Golden Rule Is ‘Get Off My Lawn’
item.description: An HBO docuseries explores neighborly drama in a well-armed and hyper-online America. In an interview, the directors considered what it all means.
item.dc:creator: Austin Considine and Brian Karlsson
item.media:credit: Brian Karlsson for The New York Times

item.title: ‘Love Story’ Recreates a Tragic Romance
item.description: The series dramatizes the relationship between John F. Kennedy Jr. and Carolyn Bessette, who married in 1996 and died a few years later. Here’s what to know.
item.dc:creator: Esther Zuckerman
item.category: Love Story: John F. Kennedy Jr. & Carolyn Bessette (TV Program)

item.title: The Times’s TV Editor Shares How He Recaps Episodes
item.description: How do we decide which television shows to write about, episode by episode? Our TV editor reveals his strategy.
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Egner
item.media:description: Peter Claffey as Ser Duncan the Tall in the premiere of “A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms” on HBO Max.

item.title: Colbert Doesn’t Give an FCC About Calling Out CBS
item.description: “And because my network clearly doesn’t want us to talk about this, let’s talk about this,” Stephen Colbert said after CBS canceled a Texas congressman’s appearance on Monday’s “Late Show.”
item.dc:creator: Trish Bendix
item.category: Late Show with Stephen Colbert (TV Program)
Last Week Tonight With John Oliver (TV Program)
Real Time With Bill Maher (TV Program)

item.title: ‘Shoresy’ Is Back, a Hockey Sitcom With ‘Heated Rivalry’ Ties
item.description: If you want more Canadian TV series about emotionally complex hockey players, look no further.
item.dc:creator: Noel Murray
item.media:description: Jared Keeso in a scene from Season 5 of “Shoresy.”

item.title: Frederick Wiseman, 96, Penetrating Documentarian of Institutions, Dies
item.description: He exposed abuses in films like “Titicut Follies,” a once-banned portrait of a mental hospital, but ranged widely in subject matter, from a Queens neighborhood to a French restaurant.
item.dc:creator: John Anderson
item.media:description: Mr. Wiseman in an undated photo. “I don’t know if I can offer a general definition of what I’m doing,” he said in 2011, “except to say I’m trying to create dramatic structures out of ordinary experience.”

item.title: Where to Watch Robert Duvall’s Top Performances
item.description: He played rugged, capable men drawn from America’s past, present and possible future.
item.dc:creator: Noel Murray
item.media:description: In “The Godfather,” Robert Duvall played a lawyer advising a band of Italians who respect his counsel but don’t consider him a trusted insider.

item.title: ‘Star Search,’ Plus 7 Things to Watch on TV This Week
item.description: The finale of Netflix’s newest talent competition airs, and the second season of “The Last Thing He Told Me” premieres.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Fidelman

item.title: ‘A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms’ Season 1, Episode 5 Recap: ‘Get Up!’
item.description: Duncan takes a serious beating. Egg doesn’t like how things are looking.
item.dc:creator: Sean T. Collins
item.category: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms (TV Program)
item.media:description: Egg (Dexter Sol Ansell) had good reason to look worried.

item.title: How ‘Wonder Man’ Can Reshape the Marvel Franchise
item.description: Our culture critic Maya Phillips analyses Marvel‘s new show “Wonder Man” and looks at how it fits into the wider multiverse.
item.dc:creator: Maya Phillips, Edward Vega and Rafaela Balster

item.title: Vicki Abt, Who Said TV Talk Shows Coarsened Society, Dies at 83
item.description: A Penn State sociology professor, she warned that hosts like Oprah Winfrey exploited vulnerable guests on television and sensationalized deviancy.
item.dc:creator: Sam Roberts

item.title: ‘The Daily Show’ Gives President Trump Yet Another Inaugural Award
item.description: Jordan Klepper congratulated the president, the sole nominee for “the Inaugural Award for Winning the Most Inaugural Awards.”
item.dc:creator: Trish Bendix
item.category: The Daily Show with Jon Stewart (TV Program)

item.title: ‘The Pitt’ Season 2, Episode 6 Recap: No Time for Goodbye
item.description: A sudden death rattles the doctors and nurses at the Pitt a little more than usual. Meanwhile, the patients keep steaming in.
item.dc:creator: Sean T. Collins
item.media:description: The bad first day back for Dr. Langdon (Patrick Ball) continued with the death of a beloved patient.

item.title: ‘How to Get to Heaven From Belfast’: Lisa McGee Spins a Comedic Mystery
item.description: Lisa McGee said she had envisaged her new show, “How to Get to Heaven From Belfast,” as a sort of modern, funny “Murder, She Wrote.” Just don’t expect tired Irish stereotypes.
item.dc:creator: Ali Watkins
item.media:description: Caoilfhionn Dunne, Roisin Gallagher and Sinead Keenan as the three protagonists of “How to Get to Heaven From Belfast.”

item.title: How ‘The Traitors’ Builds Its Perfect Reality TV Cast
item.description: The casting executives behind the Emmy-winning reality competition reveal how they create a mad mix of modern celebrity.
item.dc:creator: Joe Coscarelli

item.title: TV, It’s Not Just for Humans Anymore
item.description: Videos aimed at pets are drawing millions of views. But who’s actually watching?
item.dc:creator: Emily Anthes

item.title: Late Night Boos Pam Bondi’s ‘Bratty’ Behavior
item.description: “If downplaying international sex rings were an Olympic sport, Bondi would take home the gold,” Jordan Klepper said on “The Daily Show.”
item.dc:creator: Trish Bendix
item.category: The Daily Show with Jon Stewart (TV Program)

item.title: Tara Lipinski and Johnny Weir Are Skating Their Way Through “The Traitors”
item.description: On “The Traitors,” two American Olympians turned skating commentators have become fan favorites by embracing the roles of lovable fools.
item.dc:creator: Jessica Roy
item.media:description: The two friends shared a candid moment at a hotel in South Korea in 2018.

item.title: Turkish Nobel Novelist Orhan Pamuk Gets the Netflix Series He Wanted
item.description: After publishing more than 20 books and winning a Nobel Prize, the Turkish author fought to bring a celebrated novel to the screen — on his own terms.
item.dc:creator: Ben Hubbard and Emin Ozmen
item.media:description: Orhan Pamuk in his office in Istanbul, in an apartment building named for his family.

item.title: Where to Stream ‘Varsity Blues’ and James Van Der Beek’s Best Performances
item.description: The actor seemed to understand early on that his lasting legacy would be the title character of “Dawson’s Creek.” But he found ways to subvert his all-American persona.
item.dc:creator: Esther Zuckerman

item.title: James Van Der Beek: The ‘Dawson’s Creek’ Star’s Life and Career in Photos
item.description: The actor was best known for his early roles in “Dawson’s Creek” and “Varsity Blues.”
item.dc:creator: Shivani Gonzalez

item.title: In His Second Act, James Van Der Beek Starred Online as a Proud Dad and Family Man
item.description: The actor, who died on Wednesday, was most famous for “Dawson’s Creek,” but as he got older, he let fans into his real life as a father of six.
item.dc:creator: Maya Salam
item.media:description: James Van Der Beek, who died on Wednesday, with two of his six children at a charity event in 2023.

item.title: Mike Tirico Went From the Super Bowl to the Olympics on Two Cups of Coffee
item.description: As the veteran NBC sportscaster worked the Super Bowl on Sunday, he had his bags ready to go. Soon after the final whistle, a private jet whisked him to Italy.
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Morgan
item.media:description: “Let’s enjoy this,” one of Mike Tirico’s producers told him about covering the Super Bowl in California and the Winter Olympics in Italy.

item.title: Late Night Mines Trump’s Million Mentions in the Epstein Files
item.description: “A million times? There’s not even that many references to Hamlet in the play ‘Hamlet,’” Jordan Klepper said on “The Daily Show.”
item.dc:creator: Trish Bendix
item.category: The Daily Show with Jon Stewart (TV Program)

item.title: In ‘Love Story,’ Sarah Pidgeon Has Big Stilettos to Fill
item.description: Playing Carolyn Bessette-Kennedy, the actress faced a backlash before filming even finished. She “had to just keep betting on myself and what my instincts were.”
item.dc:creator: Alexis Soloski and Caroline Tompkins
item.category: Love Story: John F. Kennedy Jr. & Carolyn Bessette (TV Program)
item.media:credit: Caroline Tompkins for The New York Times
